Expected Behaviour:
Volume must be in Busy (Down(Degraded)) state.
After timeout volume must go into down state & I/O stats can be seen on initiator node.
Pod should be in running state and IO should continue even if volume is in down state
After deleting pods we can force detach/delete volumes. normal delete should fail
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) Created 8 fio pods on appserv70 attached to volumes on appserv71.
2) Turned down the management interface on the target i.e appserv71
3) The volumes went into Down(Degraded) state on appserv71. However, the pods stayed in the Running state.
4) dctl volume delete failed with the error stating the the volume was still attached to te pod.
5) Normal Dctl volume detach didnt throw an error, but the command did not work. -- force detach also didnt work.
6) Then one of the pod was deleted and then the corresponding volume could be deleted using --force.
 Without the use of --force the volume delete didnt through any error, but the volume got stuck in pendingDelete state.

Test Description: Node management interface down and up after volume moves to Down state.  Pods are still running.
Expected Behaviour: Volumes must should move to Busy state and IOs should continue
Notes / Detailed Description: Volumes got reattached. State changed from Down(Degraded) to Attached.

Test Description: With Replication Controller and management interface goes down
Expected Behaviour: Volume remains in Down (phase : Available) IOs should continue
Notes / Detailed Description: When the management interface was turned down on the target node, the volume became Down(Degraded), RCs remained in Running state. Cluster status changed to NoFaultTolerance and the node got into Failed state. The volumes got reattached after the mgmt interface was turned up again.

Expected Behaviour: Pod remans in CreashLoppBack state, volume remains in Busy state.
Notes / Detailed Description:
Rebooted the target node where all the volumes were created.
All the pods went into Error state and finally into CrashLoopBackOff state. In the mean time, after timeout all the volumes went into Down(Degraded) state. When the node came up, all the volumes went back into Attached state. However, the pods stayed in CrashLoopBackOff state.

Test Description: etcd master's managment interface not reachable.
Expected Behaviour: According to its position in cluster ( whether it is initiator or target)
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) etcd master was the target node
2) when the management interface was shout down on the etcd master,  node and k8s status changed to failed state and the etcd master migrated to another node.
3) All the volumes went into Down(Degraded) state where as the pods stayed in Runnung state
4) After the management interface was turned up, the cluster status got back to healthy and all the volumes were re attached to the corresponding pods.

Test Description: cluster master's managment interface not reachable
Expected Behaviour: According to its position in cluster ( whether it is initiator or target)
Notes / Detailed Description:
1) cluster master was the target node
2) when the management interface was shut down on the cluster master, node and k8s status changed to failed state and the cluster master migrated to another node.
3) All the volumes went into Down(Degraded) state where as the pods stayed in Runnung state
4) After the management interface was turned up, the cluster status got back to healthy and all the volumes were re attached to the corresponding pods.
Gateway disappears after down & up management interface

Test Description: Master change after management inface down of current master node
Notes / Detailed Description: This is covered in the above TC.
